div.p: Below are some examples that demonstrate how the elements and extensions in this implementation guide are intended to be used in a Questionnaire. Note: The rendering of the questions in the "Sample Question" tab are not functional (i.e. no validations after entry, perform actual computations, etc). They only provide a visual presentation of the questions and do not mimic how they will work in an actual questionnaire.
To display a question text in green. (Example Questionnaire)
To allow different styles to different portions of a question text. (Example Questionnaire)
Please answer Yes or No to each of the following questions:

text.value: Please answer Yes or No to each of the following questions:

valueString.value: Please answer Yes or No to each of the following questions:

div.p: To indicate what kind of display item it is so that systems can apply differential formatting based on the purpose of the display element. (Example Questionnaire)
ALL QUESTIONS CONTAINED IN THIS QUESTIONNAIRE ARE OPTIONAL AND WILL BE KEPT STRICTLY CONFIDENTIAL.

text.value: The text provides guidance on how the information will be handled from a security perspective.
ALL QUESTIONS CONTAINED IN THIS QUESTIONNAIRE ARE OPTIONAL AND WILL BE KEPT STRICTLY CONFIDENTIAL.

div.p: To hide an item to a user. This example has a question for Form ID that is not displayed. (Example Questionnaire)
Event ID
To display a text box where a user can type in their answer freely. (Example Questionnaire)
If you have any other medical problems or serious injuries, please describe them here:

text.value: A control where a user can type in their answer freely.
If you have any other medical problems or serious injuries, please describe them here:

div.p: To display choices horizontally. (Example Questionnaire)
Gender: Female Male Other Unknown

text.value: A control where choices are listed with a button beside them. The button can be toggled to select or de-select a given choice. Selecting one item deselects all others.

div.p: To indicate the increment of a slider itemControl. (Example Questionnaire)
Rate your doctor: 0100%

text.value: A control where an axis is displayed between the high and low values and the control can be visually manipulated to select a value anywhere on the axis.

div.p: To set the width of a column in a table. (Example Questionnaire)

Medical History
Diabetes
Other Information
Type 1
Hypertension
Type 2
Smoker

text.value: Questions within the group are columns in the table with possible answers as rows. Used for 'choice' questions.
A control where choices are listed with a box beside them. The box can be toggled to select or de-select a given choice. Multiple selections may be possible.
A control where choices are listed with a box beside them. The box can be toggled to select or de-select a given choice. Multiple selections may be possible.

div.p: To display child items in collapsible form. (Example Questionnaire)

Relationship to patient
Father Mother Sibling
Name
Gender Female Male Other Unknown
To add a a support link to a question that will provide more information to the user. (Example Questionnaire)

Have you traveled outside the country within the last 14 days? ?
Yes
No

text.value: A control where choices are listed with a button beside them. The button can be toggled to select or de-select a given choice. Selecting one item deselects all others.
Have you traveled outside the country within the last 14 days?

div.p: To display choices with multiple columns. (Example Questionnaire)

Select Platelet:
CODE DESCRIPTION LA11165-0 Platelet anisocytosis LA11166-8 Platelet satellitism LA11167-6 Platelet large fragments LA11167-6 Platelet large fragments LA11168-4 Platelet clump LA11169-2 Platelets.agranular LA11170-0 Platelets.giant LA11172-8 Platelets.small LA11172-6 Platelets.large
To add prefixes on answer options. (Example Questionnaire)

text.value: A control where choices are listed with a button beside them. The button can be toggled to select or de-select a given choice. Selecting one item deselects all others.

div.p: To add prefixes on a value set. (Example Questionnaire)

Enter timing of harm assessment:
A. Within 24 hours
B. After 24 hours but before 3 days
C. Three days or later
D. Unknown
To add instructions for the user to guide their input. (Example Questionnaire)
Birth Date
To indicate that the style extensions on a resource is essential. (Example Questionnaire)
To set an item for optional display. (Example Questionnaire)
Enter your Middle Name

text.value: During the past year, what was the total combined income for you and the family members you live with? This information will help us determine if you are eligible for any benefits.

div.p: To display a shorter text for an item. (Example Questionnaire)
Annual family income

text.value: During the past year, what was the total combined income for you and the family members you live with? This information will help us determine if you are eligible for any benefits.

div.p: To restrict an answer to only have 50 characters. (Example Questionnaire)
Enter your First Name
To restrict an answer to have at least 2 characters. (Example Questionnaire)
Enter your Last Name
To restrict an answer to be in this format: A1A 1A1 (Example Questionnaire)
Postal Code (A1A 1A1)
To restrict an answer to range from 1 to 100, up to 2 decimal places (Example Questionnaire)
Enter your weight in kg
To restrict the answer to range from 10 to 100 kilograms. (Example Questionnaire)

Body Weight
kg lb_av g
To only allow a JPG or PDF attachment, up to 1,048,576 bytes. (Example Questionnaire)
Attach Proof of Citizenship
To restrict choices from a fixed list. (Example Questionnaire)

(I/We) worried whether (my/our) food would run out before (I/we) got money to buy more.
Often true Sometimes true Never true

text.value: (I/We) worried whether (my/our) food would run out before (I/we) got money to buy more.

div.p: To display answer options as images using the rendering-xhtml extension. Example shows two ways to use tags to display images: (1) with embedded data and (2) using contained Binary resources.
How are you feeling today?

publisher.value: HL7 International - FHIR Infrastructure Work Group

div.p: To restrict choices from a value set. (Example Questionnaire)

Activity Level
Often Rarely Sometimes Never Always
To restrict choices to distinct value sets based on context.

p.i: NOTE: This example makes assumptions about the correlation between declared gender and health conditions that are not necessarily safe/clinically appropriate, so treat this as a technical example, not as an appropriate mechanism for data capture.

div.p:
Applicable health conditions :
Hypertension Diabetes Erectile disfunction
To restrict control which choices are enabled based on context. (Example Questionnaire)

p.i: NOTE: This example makes assumptions about the correlation between declared gender and health conditions that are not necessarily safe/clinically appropriate, so treat this as a technical example, not as an appropriate mechanism for data capture.

div.p:
Applicable health conditions :
Hypertension Diabetes Pregnancy Erectile disfunction
To require an answer. (Example Questionnaire)
Email*
To only display a populated answer and make it non-editable. (Example Questionnaire)
Current Date:
To allow multiple answers, no limit and to specify label for alternate answer choices.

Heart History (check all that applies):
Heart attack
Heart surgery
Cardiac catheterization
Coronary angioplasty (PTCA)
Cardiac pacemaker
Other event (specify):
Must have at least to 2 answers.

Heart History (check at least 2):
Heart attack
Heart surgery
Cardiac catheterization
Coronary angioplasty (PTCA)
Cardiac pacemaker
Can only have up to 3 answers.

Heart History (check no more than 3):
Heart attack
Heart surgery
Cardiac catheterization
Coronary angioplasty (PTCA)
Cardiac pacemaker
To restrict other answers from being selected when an exclusive answer (like "None of the above") has been selected.

What treatments do you now have for heart disease? (select all that applies)
No treatment
Aspirin
Other medicines, tablets, or pills
Diet
Exercise
None of the above

text.value: What treatments do you now have for heart disease? (select all that applies)

div.p: Restrict unit choices using unit options.

Dosage
ml liters mg grams
Restrict unit choices from a value set.

Specify age:
minutes hours days weeks months years

div.h4: Using answerExpression, referenceResource, referenceProfile and lookupQuestionnaire
div.p: Restrict an answer to a specific resource or profile.

Select your preferred practitioner:
Hamilton, Bill Saunders, Theresa Smith, Paul
Example with an initial expression.
Deadline for submission (7 days from now)

text.value: Deadline for submission (7 days from now)

div.p: To set resources that provide context for form processing logic.

Last Name: Hamilton
First Name: William
Gender: male

valueString.value: The patient that is to be used to pre-populate the form

div.p:
Example with a calculated expression.
Note: The questions below are not functional. The BMI will not calculated and displayed after input.

Weight (kg)
Body Height (inches)
Your Body Mass Index (BMI) is
Example question with a cqf-calculatedValue for minimum and maximum weight allowed and a question using a cqf-expression to determine if a question is required based on Patient data.

Enter weight in kg
Enter email address

valueString.value: The patient that is to be used to pre-populate the form

div.p: Text example with cqf-expression.
Your last immunization was on [Jan 1, 2021].
Example of options with initial value.

Marital Status
Single Married Divorced Widowed

Example of enabling behaviors.
Note: The questions below are not functional. Display does not show actual enabling behaviors.

Choose Gender
Male Female Other Unknown
Are you pregnant? (enableWhen gender = Female)
Yes No Don't know
Are you diabetic? (enableWhen gender = Female)
Yes No Don't know
Have you been diagnosed with Gestational Diabetes? (enableBehavior = only when pregnant and diabetic)
Yes No Don't know
Enter your birthdate (MM/DD/YYYY)
Have you had mammogram before?(enableWhenExpression = only when gender is female and age > 40)
Yes No Don't know

text.value: Are you pregnant? (enableWhen = gender is Female)
Are you diabetic? (enableWhen = gender is Female)
Have you been diagnosed with Gestational Diabetes? (enableBehavior = only when pregnant and diabetic)
Have you had mammogram before?(enableWhenExpression = only when gender is female and age > 40)

div.p:
Example involving ordinal value and contraints.
Note: The questions below are not functional. The total score will not be calculated and displayed after input.

You should answer at least three questions.
Over the last 2 weeks, how often have you been bothered by any of the following problems?
1. Little interest or pleasure in doing things
Not at all (0) Several Days (1) More than half the days (2) Nearly every day (3)
2. Feeling down, depressed, or hopeless
Not at all (0) Several Days (1) More than half the days (2) Nearly every day (3)
3. Trouble falling or staying asleep, or sleeping too much
Not at all (0) Several Days (1) More than half the days (2) Nearly every day (3)
4. Feeling tired or having little energy
Not at all (0) Several Days (1) More than half the days (2) Nearly every day (3)
Total Score: 0

description.value: The answer list for timing of harm assessment

valueString.value: At least three questions must be answered to have a meaningful total.
You should answer at least three questions.

text.value: Over the last 2 weeks, how often have you been bothered by any of the following problems?

div.p: Example of signature required.
Signature of Patient: [only show signature pad when capturing data]

text.value: the signature of a witness to any other signature.

div.p: To set an endpoint URL for the Form Receiver when the Questionnaire is completed.
[Not applicable to a question item - this extension is part of a base Questionnaire's metadata]
To display questions one at a time.
[Not applicable to a question item - this extension is part of a base Questionnaire's metadata]
To provide a list of candidate answers for the question item.

All the practitioners below can speak your language. Choose all preferred practioners:

First Name Gender

Moseley Henry Male
Upton Isaac Male
Williams Amy Female

description.value: active practitioners that speak at least one of the patient's language

text.value: All the practitioners below can speak the patient's language. Choose all preferred practioners:

div.p: To indicate the resources to make available for display to the user to aid in answering the question.

Instruction: Click on "Review Previous Visits" button to view all the visits of this patient in the past year.
Has the patient been admitted for this issue on any visits in the past year? Review Previous Visits
Yes
No
Don't know

text.value: The text provides guidance on how to populate or use a portion of the questionnaire
Instruction: Click on "Previous Visits" button to view all the visits of this patient in the past year.

description.value: list all Encounters with patient in the past year, in order by date - newest to oldest

text.value: A control where choices are listed with a button beside them. The button can be toggled to select or de-select a given choice. Selecting one item deselects all others.
